Check for forensic reports (fingerprints, DNA analysis, blood spatter analysis).
Collect phone records and call logs if applicable.

evidence_map.consolidated_text:
FIRST INFORMATION REPORT (FIR)
Police Station: Shivaji Nagar Police Station, Pune
FIR No: 423/2025
Date: 18/03/2025
Time: 23:10 hrs
Complainant:
Name: Ramesh Kulkarni
Age: 36
Occupation: Accountant
Address: Flat 301, Sai Apartment, Lane 3, Shivaji Nagar, Pune
Incident Details:
On 18 March 2025, at approximately 20:50 hrs, I heard loud shouting and noises consistent with a
physical fight coming from Flat 302 (residence of Arun Patil). Around 21:00 hrs, I observed an unknown
male, approximately 5’10”, wearing a black shirt and blue jeans, running down the staircase. The man
appeared to be holding a metallic object in his right hand.
Upon entering the flat with another neighbor, we found Arun Patil lying near the sofa with injuries on his
left arm and head. Blood was visible on the floor near the living room.
Sections Applied:
- IPC Section 452 – House-trespass after preparation for hurt
- IPC Section 324 – Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons
- IPC Section 307 – Attempt to murder
Witnesses Listed:
1. Ramesh Kulkarni
2. Sunita More (Flat 303)
3. Sanjay Patil (Flat 301)
Action Taken:
- Victim shifted to Sassoon General Hospital at 21:40 hrs
- Knife-like object recovered near staircase landing
- CCTV footage collected from apartment main gate camera
---
MEDICO-LEGAL CASE REPORT (MLC)
Sassoon General Hospital, Pune
MLC No: 1198/2025
Patient Details:
Name: Arun Patil
Age: 34
Sex: Male
Address: Flat 302, Sai Apartment, Shivaji Nagar, Pune
Date of Examination: 18/03/2025
Time: 22:15 hrs
Injury Report:
1. Sharp Weapon Injury:
- Deep laceration approximately 7 cm on left forearm
- Edges clean-cut, likely caused by sharp-edged weapon
2. Blunt Force Trauma:
- Contusion on left side of head
- Swelling observed around temple region
- Caused by impact with hard object
3. Vital Assessment:
- Pulse: 98/min
- BP: 110/70
- Consciousness: Semi-conscious on arrival
Doctor’s Opinion:
- The injury on the arm is consistent with a sharp-edged weapon like a knife.
- Head injury may indicate struggle or assault.
- Injuries could be life-threatening without timely medical assistance.
Doctor:
Dr. Meera Deshpande
MBBS, MD (Emergency Medicine)
Registration No: 88231
---
WITNESS STATEMENT
Statement Recorded Under Section 161 CrPC
Name: Ramesh Kulkarni
Age: 36
Address: Flat 301, Sai Apartment, Shivaji Nagar, Pune
Statement Given On: 18/03/2025
Time: 23:45 hrs
I was inside my flat when I heard continuous shouting and sounds of household items falling coming
from Flat 302. The noise continued for 5–10 minutes. When I came outside at around 21:00 hrs, I
noticed a man running down the stairs in a hurried manner. He appeared to be around 5'10", medium
build, wearing a black shirt and blue jeans.
Although the corridor lighting was dim, I could see that he was holding something metallic in his right
hand. I cannot confirm whether it was a knife, but it appeared sharp.
When I, along with my neighbor Sanjay Patil, entered the flat, we found Arun Patil lying unconscious
with blood near his left forearm and head. We immediately called the police helpline number 100.
This statement is true to the best of my knowledge.
(Signature)
Ramesh Kulkarni
18/03/2025
